definition: A short, pithy saying in general use, expressing a general truth.
mnemonic: Adage sounds like 'add age,' implying something old or wise, like an old saying.
visual_representation: Imagine an elder sharing a wise proverb with younger people, symbolizing an adage.
example_sentence: 'A stitch in time saves nine' is a well-known adage that suggests acting early can prevent bigger problems.

definition: (Of a legislative body) having two branches or chambers.
mnemonic: Bicameral sounds like 'bi-camera,' indicating two parts or chambers.
visual_representation: Picture a parliament building with two separate chambers, symbolizing a bicameral legislature.
example_sentence: The United States Congress is bicameral, consisting of the Senate and the House of Representatives.

definition: To examine (a book, movie, etc.) officially and suppress unacceptable parts; an official who examines material to be published and suppresses any parts considered obscene or politically unacceptable.
mnemonic: Censor sounds like 'sensor,' which detects and removes unwanted content.
visual_representation: Imagine a red marker crossing out parts of a book, symbolizing censorship.
example_sentence: The government decided to censor the film because of its controversial content.

definition: Outward behavior or bearing.
mnemonic: Demeanor sounds like 'demon-or,' suggesting how one carries or presents oneself.
visual_representation: Picture someone with a calm and composed demeanor during a tense situation.
example_sentence: Her friendly demeanor made her well-liked by everyone in the office.

definition: To give the right to vote to someone; to grant a franchise to a company.
mnemonic: Enfranchise sounds like 'in franchise,' as in granting rights or inclusion.
visual_representation: Picture people casting their votes for the first time, symbolizing enfranchisement.
example_sentence: The movement sought to enfranchise women and ensure they had the right to vote.

definition: To deceive or swindle someone out of money; the woolly covering of a sheep or goat.
mnemonic: Fleece sounds like 'flee with ease,' as if taking someone’s money easily and running away.
visual_representation: Picture a con artist taking someone’s money and running away, symbolizing fleecing.
example_sentence: The tourists were fleeced by the street vendor who charged them double the usual price.

definition: Pompous or extravagant in language, style, or manner, especially in a way that is intended to impress.
mnemonic: Grandiloquent sounds like 'grand eloquent,' indicating a style of speaking that is overly grand or pompous.
visual_representation: Imagine someone giving a speech full of big, fancy words to impress others, symbolizing grandiloquence.
example_sentence: The politician’s grandiloquent speech was filled with complex words that didn’t really say much.

definition: Lacking any obvious principle of organization; random.
mnemonic: Haphazard sounds like 'half hazard,' indicating something done carelessly or randomly.
visual_representation: Picture a messy room with items scattered everywhere without any order, symbolizing haphazardness.
example_sentence: The project was completed in a haphazard manner, with no clear plan or organization.

definition: The quality of being impudent; impertinence; disrespectful boldness.
mnemonic: Impudence sounds like 'improper dance,' as if someone is acting in a disrespectful or bold manner.
visual_representation: Imagine a student talking back to a teacher with a smirk, symbolizing impudence.
example_sentence: The child’s impudence shocked the adults at the dinner table.

definition: An uncouth or aggressive man or boy.
mnemonic: Lout sounds like 'loud,' indicating someone who is loud, rude, or uncouth.
visual_representation: Picture a rough, aggressive man pushing others aside rudely, symbolizing a lout.
example_sentence: The lout made a scene at the bar, yelling and shoving people around.

definition: Subject to sudden or unpredictable changes of mood or mind.
mnemonic: Mercurial sounds like 'mercury,' which moves quickly and changes form, indicating rapid mood changes.
visual_representation: Picture someone’s emotions changing rapidly, from happy to angry, symbolizing mercurial behavior.
example_sentence: Her mercurial temperament made it difficult to predict how she would react.

definition: A person who studies or collects coins, paper currency, and medals.
mnemonic: Numismatist sounds like 'numbers specialist,' indicating someone who specializes in coins or currency.
visual_representation: Picture someone examining ancient coins with a magnifying glass, symbolizing a numismatist.
example_sentence: The numismatist proudly displayed his collection of rare coins from around the world.

definition: To exclude someone from a society or group.
mnemonic: Ostracize sounds like 'ostrich size,' as if someone is being treated like an outcast.
visual_representation: Picture a group of people turning their backs on one person, symbolizing ostracization.
example_sentence: The community ostracized him after he was caught cheating.

definition: Translucently clear; easily understood.
mnemonic: Pellucid sounds like 'pel-lucid,' indicating something clear or easy to understand.
visual_representation: Picture a crystal-clear stream of water where every stone at the bottom is visible, symbolizing pellucidity.
example_sentence: The teacher’s explanations were pellucid, making the complex topic easy to grasp.

definition: A prescribed course of medical treatment, diet, or exercise for the promotion or restoration of health.
mnemonic: Regimen sounds like 'regime,' indicating a systematic plan or routine.
visual_representation: Picture a daily schedule with specific times for exercise, meals, and rest, symbolizing a regimen.
example_sentence: He followed a strict fitness regimen to prepare for the marathon.

definition: A college that prepares students to be priests, ministers, or rabbis.
mnemonic: Seminary sounds like 'seminar-y,' a place where religious seminars or teachings take place.
visual_representation: Picture a group of students studying religious texts in a peaceful setting, symbolizing a seminary.
example_sentence: He studied theology at the seminary before becoming a priest.

definition: Very hot and dry; full of passionate or highly charged emotions.
mnemonic: Torrid sounds like 'torrent,' indicating something intense or scorching.
visual_representation: Picture a desert landscape under a blazing sun, symbolizing torrid heat.
example_sentence: The torrid summer heat made it nearly impossible to go outside during the day.

definition: (Of a person or movement) awkward; clumsy.
mnemonic: Ungainly sounds like 'un-gainly,' indicating someone who moves in an awkward or clumsy manner.
visual_representation: Picture someone tripping over their own feet while walking, symbolizing ungainly movement.
example_sentence: The ungainly teenager struggled to keep up with the dance steps.

definition: (Especially of a person or speech) vehement or clamorous.
mnemonic: Vociferous sounds like 'voice furious,' indicating someone who is loudly expressing their anger or opinion.
visual_representation: Picture someone shouting loudly in protest, symbolizing vociferous behavior.
example_sentence: The vociferous crowd demanded immediate action from the government.

definition: Skilled at gaining an advantage, especially deceitfully; crafty.
mnemonic: Wily sounds like 'will-y,' someone who uses their will or cleverness to outsmart others.
visual_representation: Picture a fox sneaking through a forest, symbolizing cunning and wily behavior.
example_sentence: The wily fox managed to escape the hunter’s trap once again.
